Jx.Slider

This class wraps the mootools-more slider class to make it more Jx friendly

Copyright 2009 by Jonathan Bomgardner License: MIT-style

Summary
Jx.SliderThis class wraps the mootools-more slider class to make it more Jx friendly
Options
templateThe template used to render the slider
maxThe maximum value the slider should have
minThe minimum value the slider should ever have
stepThe distance between adjacent steps.
modeWhether this is a vertical or horizontal slider
wheelWhether the slider reacts to the scroll wheel.
snapwhether to snap to each step
startAtThe value, or step, to put the slider at initially
offset
Functions
renderCreate the slider but does not start it up due to issues with it having to be visible before it will work properly.
startCall this method after the slider has been rendered in the DOM to start it up and position the slider at the startAt poisition.
setset the value of the slider
enableUse this to enable the slider if disabled.
disableUse this to disable the slider.

Options

template

The template used to render the slider

max

The maximum value the slider should have

min

The minimum value the slider should ever have

step

The distance between adjacent steps.  For example, the default (1) with min of 0 and max of 100, provides 100 steps between the min and max values

mode

Whether this is a vertical or horizontal slider

wheel

Whether the slider reacts to the scroll wheel.

snap

whether to snap to each step

startAt

The value, or step, to put the slider at initially

offset

Functions

render

render: function ()

Create the slider but does not start it up due to issues with it having to be visible before it will work properly.

start

start: function ()

Call this method after the slider has been rendered in the DOM to start it up and position the slider at the startAt poisition.

set

set: function(value)

set the value of the slider

enable

enable: function()

Use this to enable the slider if disabled.

disable

disable: function()

Use this to disable the slider.

render: function ()
Create the slider but does not start it up due to issues with it having to be visible before it will work properly.
start: function ()
Call this method after the slider has been rendered in the DOM to start it up and position the slider at the startAt poisition.
set: function(value)
set the value of the slider
enable: function()
Use this to enable the slider if disabled.
disable: function()
Use this to disable the slider.
